Reviews.Title: “No faults”
Reviews.Author: parkerevans
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in march. Location was ideal for paddington station. Received upgrade to a club room on second floor- very large with two double beds. Room and bathroom were clean, spacious and well laid out. Breakfast was excellent and staff extremely friendly. Ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: RogerArscott
Reviews.Content: After years of second rate hotels at first rate prices, the Shaftesbury Premier Hotel was a delight. Excellent reception area, excellent staff, excellent room. All round first class.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value. Small room but well furnished. Tv remote was a bid dodgy! Staff very helpful, breakfast was better than most hotels I have stayed in . V. Good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: Room wasn't too big, but we had a small kitchen and the bed was very comfortable.Bedroom was very modern and clean. Location was excellent, close to Hyde Park and center if you go for the pubs and nightclubs around Oxford area. Breakfast was very rich and personel was very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, nice hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: valeria v
Reviews.Content: I stayed five days in this hotel...i came on business in London..so I liked very much because I felt good...the staff was very nice and helpful. The girl in reception always answered to my question and gave me information about places you can visit... I had an enjoyable stay in this hotel... I recommend to all my friends... and come back soon...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessMcP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location on a pleasant street around the corner from paddington station. Wonderful location! However, while the rooms were clean and pleasant they were absolutely tiny and very noisy. You could not walk around our bed and there was not enough floor space for our two bags. You can also hear everything going on in the rooms next door as well as in the hallway. Overall, I would recommend staying in paddington but this hotel is overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: July3456
Reviews.Content: I was visiting London with my family, we booked a familly room. The room was good, clean and cozy, we had a good expirience. We had a small problem with the remote control, it was not working, but after informing the staff, they were very helpfull, someone came and give us a new one. Reception staff was nice and helpfull giveing us indications and helping with our issues, we enjoyed our holliday, london was great, and the hotel very good. I will defenetly recommend this hotel, was very good

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm not so good”
Reviews.Author: BiancaH1979
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the UK with my father and booked over the internet 5 nights accomodation at the Shaftesbury. I had not stayed in Uk hotels before and did not realise that this poky, uneven floor, damp, room could be let for such high prices. As i was travelling with my Dad we both wanted a bit of our own personal space which was not at all possible here. Our twin accomodation was a joke with bearly enough room to walk between the bed let alone juggle our suitcases and belongings around the furniture in the room. I wouldnt stay here again but on a whole I love touring England and Scotland and think I have just found the winging pom inside if me. Sorry Shaftesbury!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: I've stay here for a week. Is a very nice hotel and the employees were very nice with me. The girl from the front desk was very helpful when I've requested her information about a tourist guide and about the places I've wanted to visit. I've enjoyed the fact that the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, small bed, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Brenda J
Reviews.Content: Our room, which we had booked weeks beforehand, was supposed to be a double but was so small that the bed had to be right up against one wall - more like a converted broom cupboard than a bedroom. The bed itself was not a full-sized double (not enough room for that) and it was dreadful for my 6' 3" husband and me. Although we had checked in at around midday we could not have our room at that time so it wasn't until our return from the theatre and dinner that we discovered how bad the room was. The staff then had the cheek to tell us that we should have checked in earlier and that the room was all they had left. We wouldn't stay there again if it was the last hotel in London and we can't recommend anything about it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dreary and noisy”
Reviews.Author: evaslattery
Reviews.Content: I was in a room at the front and as there was no double glazing traffic was very loud. This combined with lift and door noises all night did not make for pleasant stay. The rooms need modernising with dated curtains and blanket. How this is classed as 4 star is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff...nice hotel....”
Reviews.Author: elisa828
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, and I enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is nice and clean, every day the housekeeping staff was cleaning my room. When I needed help with indications , reception staff was very helpfull and nice, smileing all the time and haveing a pozitiv attitude. I will defenetly come back and I will recomand to my friends, is a good hotel!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vania B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business visit. Neat room with warm welcoming staff. Mordern bar with a cool bar man serving drinks makes more enjoyable. " NO WIFIs IN ROOM" but have a broadband connection. Cannot expect more at a price of 69.

Reviews.Title: “WE WERE HAPPY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fred and Helen S
Reviews.Content: Nice size room, clean, quiet with tea and coffee/bikkies and shower gell etc provided. Radiators are not used, you had to put the air con on to get heat, but we didnt mind, but you can see how other people might find it annoying. Bathroom spotless with under floor heating which we think was set to turbo.....if you leave the bathroom door open it will heat the room. Nice tv on the wall and comfy bed. Location brilliant . A nice safe walk from Paddington Tube, 5 minutes tops with fast food and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room/lovely breakfast/good location”
Reviews.Author: laineys
Reviews.Content: Not so bad but definetly some issues. Comfortable bed and nice modern decor but very limited space. Breakast was delicious but the food in the bar not the best. Location is great few minutes walk to Paddington and easy to navigate around on the tube to most popular sights from there. The walk with large suitcases from the station might be a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “It's location is the only redeeming quality...”
Reviews.Author: newyorker91
Reviews.Content: This is certainly one of the worst hotel I have stayed at in London in terms of service. I read several reviews prior to booking the accommodation at the Shaftesbury which hinted the hotel wasn't very good, and I regret not giving greater consideration to these sentiments. THE BAD - Someone at the hotel distributed information about my booking to a third party person who called reception. I felt that this was an unacceptable violation of my privacy. When I called to complain, the manager stated that she felt this was not wrong, because the person enquiring 'knew my name and room number'. Certainly if they were entitled to know these details, they could have asked me for this information directly. I had informed this person of my room number so that when they called the hotel they could ask to be connected to Room Number "X". I did not tell them further details about my stay for a reason. - When I called reception to request fresh towels on my second day, I was told someone would bring them up to my room. This call was made at 3.30 in the afternoon. No one came, and so at 7.30 in the evening I called reception again and requested fresh towels. Once again, I was informed that someone would bring them up, yet no one came. When I complained the following morning, the man at reception explained that no towels were brought because the staff at reception 'did not know where they were'. I found this to be a little strange, yet if this was the case then why did reception inform me that they would be able to provide me with extra towels twice? Moreover, why is it written in their guest information book that extra towels can be provided upon request? - The following morning one of the house keeping staff walked into my room without knocking. I was getting undressed at the time she opened the door. I was startled, and immediately grabbed the doona to cover myself up. Despite this, the woman did not excuse herself and stood at the door looking into the room. As I reached for clothes to put on, she walked into the room saying 'sorry' over and over again and began the housekeeping service. She did not appear to speak much English, yet common courtesy is a universal language. - The hotel room did not have air conditioning, and was uncomfortably warm even when the heating was turned off. In an attempt to regulate the temperature I opened the window, however there was an unpleasant smell outside which forced me to leave it closed. The hotel room was so warm that when I woke up in the morning I was covered in sweat and both my clothes and the bed sheets were damp. Because of this, I asked one of the housekeeping staff to kindly change my bedsheets (also stating that it was the 3rd day of my stay). She said 'no' and 'sorry' over and over again. I was confused by her refusal. My bedsheets were changed after I called reception to complain about the incident. - The mattresses are old and uncomfortable. There is a notable groove in them, and I noted that some of the springs in the mattresses in my room were poking out. - The hotel is not as clean as one would expect. I noted one or two small hairs on the bed linen when I arrived, coffee cup rings on the table, tears in the wallpaper, stains on the wallpaper, some mould in the shower, soap scum on the side of the washbasin table that faced the shower, and lipstick stains on the hairdryer. - The furniture appeared to be unstable; when I sat down on a both chairs in my room I felt the legs strain under my weight. As a person of 5'8'' weighing 50 kg, I certainly don't feel like I should worry about breaking a chair when I sit on it. - Internet access is only available through ADSL. As the cord was only 1 meter long, it restricts you to sitting at the table should you need to use the internet during your stay. THE GOOD Certainly there are a few positive things about this hotel: a large flatscreen television, a complimentary newspaper each day, a selection of recent magazines in your room (although they were limited to fashion and beauty magazines), fresh flowers in your room upon arrival (only upon arrival), two bottles of complimentary water (only upon arrival). However, these embellishments do not detract from what the hotel is lacking: the basics (!). In my opinion, the Shaftesbury's location is it's only redeeming quality.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Frenzotic
Reviews.Content: My father in law had booked 2 rooms; one for him and his wife, one for me and my other half here for 3 nights. He booked before telling us so I had to quickly check it out, the location was ideal but after reading many other reviews I felt the rooms could potentially be too small for them as they are a large couple and such a small room could be quite uncomfortable. I was quite wary of this, I was also wary about parking, parking is very limited and is on a first come first serve basis costing Â£20 a day. I made note that there was a large NCP multi storey parking nearby. When we got there there was no parking area so I parked to the kerbside, infront of the hotel, to allow the in-laws to quickly check in. We were only at reception for 5 minutes before I noticed my car outside was about to be TOWED AWAY! Yes, outside 2 men and their van were looking at my car ready to take, me and the half ran outside to quickly tell them we were just checking in. Let this be a warning not to park your car for too long or at least keep an eye on it incase. Fortunately there was parking available in a chained-off area specific to the hotel. The reception is small but clean and modern with such friendly staff. We took the lift to our floor and noticed the hallway is fairly narrow but what we noticed more was how 'soft' the carpets were. The sort of sinking-soft as if the underlayer was put in unevenly, be warned the floors like to creak a bit but it wasn't such an issue as you cannot hear it if someone walks past your room. The in-laws booked a club room for themselves and a double for us. I must admit their room took me by surprised as it was actually quite big and cosy with a lovely sofa, plasma tv and even had a microwave(sadly no fridge). They had windows and a door leading onto the roof/fire exit area, unfortunately the view is just of the side of the next building but it didn't bother them so much. The room decor is lovely and the bathroom is stylish with instant hot water(you actually have to turn the dial to slightly cold to get the perfect temperature so don't turn it on hot immediately!). I think the only issue they may have had in their room was the air con that didn't quite warm up their room enough to their liking. My and the other half's room was smaller but quite adequate for us. The only issue I may have had was there is too much lighting in the bathroom, you can't dim it or turn the lights by the sink off and the bath towels didn't smell that pleasant...rather sweaty smelling. Overall however, the stay was very pleasant, very close to the bustling streets of Craven Road which houses many restaurants, shops, hotels, pubs and the train station and underground. Would definitely recommend for it beautiful area and close proximity to all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Club room”
Reviews.Author: jaredlauralouis
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here and forgot to inform the hotel that it was to celebrate our engagement !! I emailed them a week before arriving to ask if they would offer any upgrades etc? Upon arrival we were shown into our clubroom with fresh fruit and flowers and a bottle of wine all free of charge, also had complementary breakfast! Brilliant customer service and the room was excellent! Can't fault it whatsoever and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Rude, poor service”
Reviews.Author: RobB4
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have ever seen such a rude bunch of people at a front desk in my life. The women at the front desk seemed to all be close friends and helping hotel patrons came a distant second to socializing. I sat in the lobby (cause there is no wi-fi in the rooms) and was able to listen to the desk staff dealing with customers. And several people came in and were treated with no respect and a few left. I wonder if the hotel owner has any idea?

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: DDcool1952
Reviews.Content: Excellently situated to most of those places you want to see in London not far from the the underground and five minutes walk from Hyde Park and Marble Arch. Staff very helpful room clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “keep your expectations low”
Reviews.Author: MuR_78
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not the hotel you'd want to stay if you are with you wife/girl friend and you are meant to give them a relaxing holiday as a treat. I have booked a double bedroom for 3 nights, only to find on arrival that the room is as small as you could ever imagine! There was barely any room for our luggage and we had to mind our heads, elbows ..what not to just stay away from furniture edges. The toilet was cramped too. The only positive thing I can think of is its location, the underground station is within 5 mins of walking distance and there is a nice chinese restaurant within a minute's walk.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel downtown London”
Reviews.Author: yvesganansia
Reviews.Content: I commute weekly to London for my work on Sunday night and stay there a couple of nights. This hotel was part of a British Airways package. I do consider this hotel as a big deal in London. It offers everything a four or five star luxury hotel proposes at a very reasonable price. Do not waste your money in London Hotels chose this one it is clean, rooms are not smaller than those of pricy hotels, They are brand new, luxurious as in a Five stars flat TVHD with all services, Minibar, coffee, iron, free wifi access everywhere in the hotel, nice and modern bath rooms, breakfast restaurant, nice bar and TV rooms, a business club, frankly it is the kind of hotel that has to be developed in London where you can be so often disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neerah G
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay in London with my bofriend. I was a bit worried after reading some of d reviews but i totally disagree. This hotel is very central, 2 blocks from tube station and few mins walk from Hyde Park. Room was Clean, Warm and Comfortable. Staff were very friendly starting from d reception staff to d cleaning staff. The best touch of all were the complimentary fresh apples at the front desk. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting london. Neerah Grima

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of this chain and seek asurances”
Reviews.Author: redoubtwarrior
Reviews.Content: Two things travellers need to be aware of. From these reviews it seems common that you do not get booked into the hotel of your choice. Secondly if you want a double bed make sure it is one. We were booked in at the Hyde Park hotel but on arrival at 2200h were told rather curtly by the unsmiling receptionist that due to maintenance there were no rooms and we would be transferred. the bar man made us welcome and gave us a complimentary drink while we waited for the taxi that the hotel ordered. Taxi duly arrived and dropped us off at the next Shaftesbury hotel. Wrong hotel!! Wee had to walk down the road to another of this chain's hotel--the one I am now reviewing. Of the three Shaftesbury Premiers we visited that night this was the least appealing reception but staff were very efficient and welcoming. The room was a club room and was well appointed with a sofa and armchair. Excellent TV and good wardrobe space. Terrible view of a concrete wall but as it was winter it did not matter much. The big problem for us was the double bed. It was two single beds pushed together-not only that but with single bed bedding! Not impressed but as it was late my wife was happy to put up with it rather than move (if they had any double beds). Excellent bathroom though the shower/bath water was only warm whilst the sink had very hot water. The room heating was poor, despite us complaining on the first morning. Not good in winter. Lighting could have been better as there was no light in the central part of the room. We were given complimentary breakfast to make up for having to move. It was good and a reasonable choice. Breakfast staff excellent and helpful. Hotel had poor signage, particularly to reception and to the bar and restaurant. We paid Â£142 for two nights so value wise it was probably reasonable. Not sure it should be classed as 4 star though The location is excellent for mainline rail network and tube. Very close to Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room near Tube”
Reviews.Author: Helen711
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it was near the office building my husband had to visit and he could walk. The hotel is hard to find because it is not well marked. The front door is in the middle of a block-long white building. The front desk clerks are business-like, but not friendly. The two women I dealt with were not native English speakers and didn't seem to care if I found my way or not when I asked directions to a shopping district. The elevator was out of service the whole time we were there (3 days), but a friendly porter did carry our bags up and down the stairs for us. The room was clean and well appointed (it looked like it had recently been upgraded and there was a small bouquet of fresh carnations on a small table) but one of the tiniest rooms I've ever been in. I had to turn sideways to get to my side of the bed and we had to move the chair away from the desk in order to open the doors of the closet. My husband and I were constantly in each other's way. The hallways and stairways are extremely narrow (less an a meter) and there are many fire doors that must stay closed, making it awkward and cumbersome to go from our room to the lobby, or to the basement to the breakfast room (somewhat difficult to find, but keep walking forward!) The breakfast was fresh and plentiful; hot foods were hot, there was fresh fruit and juices, three different kinds of breads including croissants,yogurt and cold cereal. The people working in the breakfast room were the only pleasant people in the place, and they remembered our drink orders each morning! The hotel is a five minute walk to the Paddington tube (from the front door, turn left and go to the corner. Turn left and walk straight down Craven Street 3 blocks to the Underground.) There are also many little shops on Craven Street where you can buy food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller59
Reviews.Content: There are two premier hotels on Westbourne Terr! On each side of the road almost opposite one another! One being the Shaftesbury premier Paddington, the other being Shaftesbury premier Hyde Park, ensure you arrive at the correct one, I arrived by cab late at night to the wrong one, the 3 reception staff waved me to the other side of the road, not too impressive for a solo female traveller late at night. The rooms are very small with insufficient space around the bed and a bathroom door that cannot open wide due to the bed. However it was clean and quiet in the "basement" the bed was comfortable and clean, plenty of towels but a TV that did not work. Good nightlight over the room door giving a dark green glow that would enable any visitor to leave the room quickly OK for one night, would be far too small for people on holiday

Reviews.Title: “Near the tube and rail but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: HameedDadi
Reviews.Content: Location is very good like 200 meters from the Paddington rail station and tube but the rooms were very small. Ac is not that good. Staff friendly but full payment at check in is a must... overall easy to get your way to any location in London if you are a tube user.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Paddington Tube Station”
Reviews.Author: Malaga.Spain
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to London for working reasons. I booked Shaftesbury Hyda Park but when I arrived at the hotel, they said they were fully booked so they said they will transfer me to a sister hotel, the got me a taxi took me to another Shafesbury and then that was full too!! so another taxi and finally I arrived at Shaftesbury Paddington. I am very upset with Shaftesbury, really bad, there were around 20 people on my situation that day. DonÃ±t use their web for booking! SHAFTESBURY PADDINGTON Excellent location, within walking distance to shops, different restaurants (a very nice Greek, recommended) and only 2 minutes walk to the Tube Station. HOTEL They have wifi area in reception and a computer for clientÂ´s use(for free). The reception is modern and clean, and receptionists are very helpful (the best of the three hotels I went to). Breakfast was included in the rate, itÂ´s buffet style and itÂ´s average. I stayed in a Club Room, nice and confy bed, new bathroom but very small, although ok for London standard. ItÂ´s a good choice for staying in Paddington area

Reviews.Title: “Great location - bizarre room!”
Reviews.Author: cookie-319
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room via Booking.com at a rate of Â£60, which the room was definitely worth, it was comfortable and clean and the location is great. What wasn't so great was the bizarre layout of the room (302). When opening the door I was faced with 7 steps down into the room, the single bed was tucked into the corner next to the staircase, with the TV facing the wardrobe (not the bed) with no 'swivel' option. Rooms do not have wi-fi, instead they have a 1 metre broadband cable. Mine was at the other side of the room from the bed, so aswell as not being able to watch TV from bed, I couldn't watch anything on my laptop either! I attempted to order room service, but the chef was ill, a member of staff kindly brought a local takeaway menu up to my room but it looked abit grim so I decided to eat out alone instead. The lack of room service was a blessing as I ended up walking 2 minutes round the corner to 'Il Gusto' and had a marvellous cannelloni (would highly recommend). I aslo didn't get looked at like a weirdo for dining alone which I highly appreciated! All in all the hotel was fine for a 1 night stay, I would stay again, but ask for a room with a TV facing the bed! (Female, 24, Leeds)

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, great staff... Great experience”
Reviews.Author: marryanna
Reviews.Content: This was my second experience with this collection of hotels... This was even better than the first experience, even thought the room was a bit smaller than the previous one, but haven't tried yet the club rooms :) The check in was smooth and lovely , done by Mary - remember cause we have the same name, amazing attitude, always smiling and helpful, we were lucky and had an early check in. Same of course the other receptionist, but maybe a bit cold... But helpful anyways. The boy from reception helped us with the luggage even thought definitely wasn't the porter, but nice attitude , always customer service first. There is a very nice bar in the lower ground floor, no gym unfortunately , but compensate with the parking facilities.... Very close to paddington station and all the restaurants in the area. Very well positioned , in a quiet area... Would definitely come back ...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: Ser579
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Friday night and had prebooked it at 99 pounds a night. We then got upgraded to a bigger room with large tv, flowers and huge bed (2 singles together but very comfortable). Would definately come back. (in fact my second time at these hotels). So close to paddington station and therefore the heathrow express. Makes travelling easier! Very comfy hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Forget it !”
Reviews.Author: Claude S
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of other people, we had not the chance to see more than the lobby of this hotel. In the morning, somebody call to let us know that they have some problems with the building so they "moved" our reservation to another hotel they manage in Notting Hill. It's a 4 stars on the paper but tiny rooms, no service and the staff is just there, nothing more to say. The problem with Shaftesbury is that they use web sites like booking.com and other to promote special offers in Paddington place and once you have booked and you're in London they call a cab and give you a room in Notting Hill ! Next time, I will try somewhere else, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Varshee
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in March this year and it was not an experience I'm in a hurry to repeat. Firstly they tried to give us a room on the bottom floor which has NO windows (OMG), I refused and they gave us a room on the 5th floor. The room was nice enough, if very small. The location of the hotel is great, close to tube and lots of shops, pubs around. On the last day of our 5 night stay, we couldnt take a shower in the morning as the hot water ran out (how can this happen in a London hotel I don't know!) Overall, very average hotel for the price. I'm sure if you search around, you will find a much better deal!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, tiny cold rooms”
Reviews.Author: agatam66
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and bathroom but they are so small that it's difficult to move around. The window was letting a cold breeze in, but the central heating wasn't switched on. We ended up using a spare blanket and putting extra clothes on during the night. The staff was very polite. We haven't tried the breakfast but there was free tee/coffee in the room as well as welcome biscuits and bottled water at arrival. There are probably more remarkable places to stay in London, but at 100gbp per night deal from lastminute.com this is satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two Hotels”
Reviews.Author: jomcvitie
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room for one night at the Shaftesbury Premier London Paddington primarily for it's location. As many others have mentioned on arrival I was told that there was no room at the Shaftesbury London Paddington and that I could instead stay at the Shaftesbury London Hyde Park. I can see how this could be annoying for some people and perhaps some people are asked to go to another hotel further afield, however as the Shaftesbury Hyde Park is located just across the road it was no big deal for me. I was also offered a complimentary full English Breakfast as compensation so I really felt I had a fair deal. The staff were really friendly and efficient, I can't comment on the rooms as I didn't stay at the Shaftesbury Paddington. I would recommend booking here if you don't mind being moved across the road and possibly getting a free breakfast, if not don't bother as from the looks on the reception staff's faces it happens A LOT!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Smallest room I've ever stayed in at a so called 4 star hotel and a single bed being described as a DOUBLE what a con. I stayed at the Shaftesbury on a theatre trip with my wife on Saturday evening and was looking forward to a 4 star DELUXE DOUBLE room as described on the booking. What I got was the equivalent of a converted store cupboard with a bed no bigger than a single. The bed length took up the whole width of the room so to get to the other side of the room you had to crawl over it. We are not big people (12 stone and 7 stone) and we found it totally inadequate. The authorities should clamp down on this misleading claim of being a double room and enforce them to describe the room fully i.e. Warning for children or very small adults only. If you our thinking that an alternative bigger, normal room may be offered then think again as when we complained we were told that ALL their rooms are of this size. My advice would be to look elsewhere as this hotel is not cheap and you will be very disappointed with what you will find.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient but small”
Reviews.Author: LeslieFay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shaftesbury for three days at the end of a two month trip before flying home to Australia. It was modern, clean, neat, tidy and pleasant. The room was very small, as was the ensuite. It was one of the smallest rooms we had stayed in in the UK or Europe. The price we found a little high considering that breakfast was not included, but we found a great cafe near the station which did quick, cheap breakfasts. Internet access was fine and the staff very pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Book to be sent off...”
Reviews.Author: Martin H
Reviews.Content: Had been booked in this hotel for five times so far. Three times I had been transferred to other hotels after a considerable waiting time. Risk to be transferred into other hotels seems to be reduced when booking double rather than single rooms. Rooms are lower London average quality; single rooms can be very small (London standard)

Reviews.Title: “overbooked on arrival, solved by offering other hotel”
Reviews.Author: donofduketown
Reviews.Content: On arrival the deskemployee said us (and some other visitors) that the Hotel was overbooked. She made excuses, and offered an other Hotel (Nothing Hill) of the same company. She also ordered a taxi. Our irritation disappeared little by little because the solution was fast and polite. Still it is a strange experience that a reservation by booking,com is no certainty for a room. They have very flexible reservation conditions, maybe is overbooking a logical consequence? See further review of Nothing Hill Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, helpfull staff!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjj234
Reviews.Content: I was visiting London with my girls, i made a booking for 3 nights, but when i arrived to the reception in their sistem my booking was just for one night, the receptionist, Arabela, she was very helpfull she sorted out for us. The room was nice and clean, not very big, but the bed was confortable.The location is very good, is close to paddington station and Hyde park, also we walked to oxford street. I will deffenetly come back!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle B
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in this Hotel. We found the staff very helpful and friendly.We arrived at about 11am but our room was ready for us which was great. The room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. The batroom was very small but very clean, bright and modern. We would stay there again as it is a great location for the Heatrow Express from Paddington.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation online and with very little information other than it was a Shaftesbury Hotel and as I was in a hurry to do so before I boarded my plane from Vancouver, and inspite of having one previous encounter with Shaftesbury in Marylebone which was regretable,I made a booking. Upon arrival at the hotel I was told my room was not available but that they had arranged for me to have a room at their "suites" a few blocks away. After waiting for 20 minutes for their car to come and deliver me I was taken to the hotel. What I got was a room that measured 144 sq ft with no air conditioning and all for the unbelievable cost of 329 pounds. I travel the world, as my job requires it, and therefore can with assurance state I've been in every type of hotel immagingable. But never have I been ripped-off more than with this Shaftesbury hotel and Shaftesbury's management. I can only state that I will never stay in another Shaftesbury hotel and I firmly recommend to anyone reading this review to do the same. This was the worst example of misrepresentation and taking advantage of the situation. "Buyer beware"

Reviews.Title: “No room at the inn”
Reviews.Author: ParkOboy
Reviews.Content: Same experience as many others at this hotel - no room available. In this case the lack of a room was because of "a maintenance problem." This has happened to me on a number of occasions at various hotels in London. After a 24 hour flight plus travel from Heathrow, it is more than annoying.

Reviews.Title: “5 minutes walk from Paddington station......”
Reviews.Author: Mark4702
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Shaftesbury Premier Hotel. Having arrived late afternoon on Friday, check in was prompt and curtious. Credit card charged for the stay upon arrival, the rest upon check out (more of that later). Westbourne Terrace is quite a major road, however the hotel has it's own 'drive way' and is therefore set back a little, therefore you don't hear much at all. It doesn't look much from outside, it's one of the houses of the same style converted, but once inside, it's quite pleasant. The room however is a little on the small side (we were in a triple room) and I note that there was not much storage space in the room nor bathroom, but hey, for 2 nights in London when all you do is sleep and shower there, it's not a problem. The room and bathroom were both very clean. As the title says, it really is only 5 minutes walk from Paddington station where you can either take the Heathrow Express (15 minutes to Terminal 1), or the Bakerloo line to Oxford Circus (10 minutes), Piccadilly Circus (12 minutes) or even the Circle and District line to anywhere else you may wish to visit...... The breakfast room was clean and there were a number of 'servers' willing to bring you coffee etc. The breakfast itself was great (3 kilos says it all :-)). A variety of English breakfast and continental breakfast available. If you pre-book upon arrival GBP12, if not, GBP15 per person per day - payable upon check-out. All in all, a pleasant stay, location great for all areas of London and a number of bars and restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: 805WCL
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Grande Royale Hyde park to be told we had to be moved to this hotel with no previous attempt to contact us that there was a problem with our booking. We were reassured that this hotel was the same standard as the booked hotel. Having paid Â£140 for a "delux double" for one night we could not have been more disappointed with the shoe box excuse for a room. It was impossible to get round one side of the bed as there was a chair between it and the wall at the end of the bed. The wardrobe doors were unable to open due to the chair between it and the dressing table. Smart new bathroom but knees touched the sink when sat on the loo! There was also no fridge in the room and no wireless internet. The bathroom was dirty with hairs in the bath and the toilet was not clean. We were extremely disappointed with the customer service we received by the reception staff, who were very rude and had a poor grasp of the English language. Although the porters have to be commended for their excellent service. I find it very hard to believe that this hotel has gained 4 stars - I felt totally ripped off. We will not be staying in a Shaftesbury hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok but bring disinfection wipes!”
Reviews.Author: lonetraveler676
Reviews.Content: I was expecting small. The size of my deluxe double was small but bigger than expected. I was on the ground floor at the front of the building, which was surprisingly quiet. The location was excellent, lots of places to drink and eat, even late at night. Just 2 mins walk to Paddington station, it was gold in location. I stayed for 6 nights. WARNING: someone forgot to tell the cleaners how to ACTUALLY clean!!! To my disgust I had only walked in the door and notices a long ginger hair on the cup and saucer. The saucer was dirty and the spoons looked like they had been sitting in old coffee for 2 weeks. I had to buy disinfection wipes, one wipe, and the spoon was clean. Every time they replaced the cups and spoons I would wash them myself. I noticed a stain on the bench. Thought it was a permanent mark. One wipe and it was gone. I realised the bench had not been cleaned for some time. There was also hair in the bathroom when I first checked in... gross. The room would have been bigger if it weren't for the heavy and dark furniture which had no real purpose with no fridge. Staff were really friendly and kindly helped me with my bags. Always a smile and a hello. I didn't get breakfast included so can't comment. Tv would randomly turn it's self off a number of times for no apparently reason and it would change it's own channel. I guess it wanted to watch something else :) When I needed help from the front desk they were all too happy to help. The place had potential just needs a few adjustments and a lesson in what's clean and what's dirty. I sterilized the glassware in the bathroom as I was concerted with which cloth they may have cleaned them with and if it were used on the loo. That's me being paranoid though. There were holes in the blanket on the bed, which looked like it had been stolen from a homeless person. The air conditioner would only blast out at one setting, a hot setting, despite it saying 5 degrees. I was melting in the room. See my pics I took.

Reviews.Title: “very hospitable”
Reviews.Author: rajesh b
Reviews.Content: hotel is conveniently located . Duty Manager Aparna Ahuja took good care of us .Microwave Oven in the room was of great help .Rooms are nice and clean .Breakfast is great .Masroor was very courtious .

Reviews.Title: “"Great hospitality and we'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: sandy_phua
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days in August .It was a business trip.My husband chose this hotel because of its great location-a mere 2mins walk to the train station with restaurants n grocery stores within the vicinity.The staff on receiption were most friendly n helpful.The room was modern, spotlessly clean and comfortable with full amenities. Loved their cookies provided. The English breakfast was good, provide free newspaper and TV station.Though it is a small hotel, it was well managed by the team : Ms Aparna, Mr Sheity & Mr Vikram.They made our stay a very memorable one. We have experienced their hospitality and will not hesitate to recommend this lovely hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Area yes - Hotel No!”
Reviews.Author: CityGrrl_1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times in the area as it is conveniently located near Paddington Station. This was the worst of the last 4 stays - the word 'Premier' is as misleading as the staff. The 'Club Rooms' are located in the basement right beneath ground floor. Not only does it sound like elephants are stampeding above you all day, but the massive air conditioner machines located right outside your window ensure you dont sleep all night. The Club Room has no fridge, no wireless and the tv remote control only works if you stand half a meter infront of it. In addition, when two separate guests asked the hotel reception for assistance with ordering a regular cab - they sent their local limo service driver who was charging double the rate and was rude when asked if this was a regular cab. Indian staff inside - when asked why a regular cab was not called - simply stated 'This is what we use'. I have no problem with hotels offering separate limo services, but trying to con tourists is unprofessional and unacceptable. Will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jimmywolf
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but clean. Hotel staff more than helpful. Had an issue with the tv but this was dealt with immediately. Staff polite, professional and prompt. Top marks to Masroor and Vikram who went out of their way to make sure the problem was resolved and I was comfortable. We are all too quick to criticise and not give credit to those who go out of their way to make sure the customer is happy. Would stay here again. Breakfast a bit dear mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Namru
Reviews.Content: If you are on a quick dash trip to London there are not many hotels that are more convinient.. 30 mins from getting off the plane at heathrow i was at the check in desk at the hotel in central London. It is a 5 minute walk from the Heathrow Express terminal at Paddington station to the lobby Hotel. Excellent staff, warm and welcoming. Rooms are quite small but it is clean, efficient and well located.A bit expensive but thatâ€™s what you get in a central London. Will surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: WillEng-London
Reviews.Content: Having worked in London for the past year, I have stayed in a number of hotels around the capital, and am a seasoned business traveller to Europe. Without exception, this constituted the worst accommodation I have encountered. The first room I was allocated was literally smaller than my dog's kennel with no floor space to accommodate my holdall, and no natural light. On complaining, I was relocated to a room marginally larger. A bath is an expectation within a four star establishment. But there was no room in the bathrooms to fit anything but a basic shower. The staff believe their accommodation to be 'bijou'. In reality this is an attempt to of justify selling cramped, claustrophobic and airless rooms to travellers. The leading chains constitute much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I have loved the way they have handled this matter.”
Reviews.Author: Hiroshi Y
Reviews.Content: The person at the reception was so solution oriented.I have loved the way they have handled this matter. This person has handled the amendments of the invoice very quickly on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “"Never again"”
Reviews.Author: Svein L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace - avoid it! They promise a lot of facilities for their upgraded rooms, but these facilites do not exist. They charge you for services they do not provide.

Reviews.Title: “5* Service in 4* Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: CitySleeker
Reviews.Content: A well well located boutique hotel within easy access of Paddington station. Must say the Girls were very Welcoming at all times, (Monica, Catarina and duty manager Aparna). They seemed rather well groomed and with very smart uniforms. The evening Porter very helpful and efficient. They all helped to make my stay very pleasant and enjoyable. Definitely 5* Service in 4* Accommodation! However, must say the Rooms are extremely small and the prices rather high, when compared. No SKY T.V for the price, not in the rooms, not in the Bar and not even in the Club Lounge, what a shame? Wanted to watch the cricket, so had to pop out for a drink, what a pity! Well the only good thing England won 1-0. The service alone will make me come back again otherwise this Property needs to be improved considerably if your going to charge such high prices!

Reviews.Title: “Happy to have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Alice0529
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were not so happy to see they gave us a room in the basement... Next to the bar! We complained and were moved the next day to a much nicer and bigger room on the 4th floor. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We will sure stay here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “great location, adequate facility”
Reviews.Author: REB266
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights (2 parents plus a 10-year old girl). The room was clean, but slightly out of date, and the bed was uncomfortable. The staff seemed overworked, as there was always a large line at reception with issues needing solving; without a concierge it was hard to get assistance from the staff. We used their laundry service which, although expensive and ultimately successful, was extremely slow (indeed, it was 10:30 before it was returned to us) and involved at least one error. When we tried to get the desk to help us, we were told that was one of their colleagues' concerns. Despite this, the hotel is in a prime location - only a short five minute walk to Paddington, with its access to Heathrow and central London. Although there is nothing wrong with the hotel, and it was fine for the rate we paid, we would probably stay elsewhere on a subsequent visit.

Reviews.Title: “Shoe boxed size rooms and overpriced!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelBug6753
Reviews.Content: What can i say, the name of this hotel is very misleading!! It's not as great as it sounds!! The room is so tiny you can barely breathe in there, let alone fit your luggage in the room without having it in the walkway!! I couldn't stand been in this room, it's definitley not a place to relax!! Also the prices that they charge are way too expensive, i would rather stay in a hostel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good things and bad things”
Reviews.Author: lbjohnik2
Reviews.Content: God things: +Location (100-150 m away from Paddington station) in a rather calm and quiet area. +New fresh, clean bathroom +Friendly helpfull staff +Nice breakfast Not so god things: -Very small room - read earlier reviews. In our room there were staircase down to the room. -The whole hotell was small and the lobby lacked the We had some problems getting internet started - via cable - and got exelent help from Masroor who first helped us with our bags!

Reviews.Title: “Single room too small to be a "Premier" hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Reality50
Reviews.Content: Singel room is about 3 meters x 2 meters (9 feet x 6 feet). Shower cabin is about 60 cm x 60 cm (2 feet x 2 feet). Water pressure in the shower is low. For these reasons it is misleading to call the room "Single Deluxe Room". It would not be possible to travel with a large suitcase and stay in this room. It is not clear why the owners of this hotel use the name "Premier" in this connection. Location is convenient: just about three minutes walking distance from the Paddington railway and tube station, and close also to Lancaster Gate tube station on Central Line.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: arferdaily
Reviews.Content: The smallest room I have ever stayed in and no hot water for a shower in the morning ! No apology and no offer of compensation. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A SCANDAL dishonest system”
Reviews.Author: Lau35
Reviews.Content: Wehen we arrived they pretended maintenance problems (with everyone apparently) and try to reorient you to another hotel, less good and in another place (after you have paid everything of course). Then 45 mns after arrival still no taxi, no room and no possibility to obtain reimbursment (despite threatening of the police). This is clearly a well established system (everyone else were in the same situation). THIS HOTEL SHOULD BE AVOIDED AT ALL COSTS they are just completely dishonest and do not offer what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Profiteering by overbooking without regard for customer service”
Reviews.Author: MrG1980
Reviews.Content: They allow you to book this hotel, then on arrival tell you there are 'maintenance issues' and you'll have to move to one of their sister hotels of 'equal quality'. Having read other reviews, it seems that this is standard practice. The manager has even responded to one review to apologise and say it will not happen again..... We booked this hotel for its proximity to Paddington as we were arriving on a late train. Despite having booked more than a month in advance, they had no rooms. As the reception staff were trainees and the manager lives out of town, there was nothing they could do except ask us to stay one night in their Kensington Town House, and come back here for the second night. They offered us a 'complimentary' taxi (I should bloody well say so). The manager knew about the 'maintenance issues' and should have arranged for equal (Town House is not as good) or better accomodation in Paddington, since this is where we had paid to be. And shouldn't have left trainees on reception without authorisation to deal with these issues. Whilst we remonstrated with them, another very similar argument was going on next to us with another couple, seems a pretty common occurence. We asked them to show us where on the map Kensington Town House was, and they pointed vaguely at Kensington Gardens (it's a park!). They didn't even know where they were sending us!! We had to ask them for the address, then look it up ourselves, then show them where it was on the map! Outrageous. In the end, we stayed one night at the Town House (having declined their Hyde Park two single rooms offer - we're a couple on a weekend in London!!), and transferred back to Paddington, where we were upgraded to a Club Room, given free breakfast both mornings, a bottle of wine and plate of fruit to compensate our disappointment. Despite these efforts to compensate, we wanted two nights in the location we had chosen and booked in advance without the inconvenience of moving between hotels. Overall, felt that they were trying to buy us off, for deliberately overbooking, to fill a lesser quality hotel in a location we didn't want to be. We wouldn't book this hotel again until we had had assurances from customer reviews (not just management response) that this practice of overbooking has been stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: mabett
Reviews.Content: I was in one of the rooms on the lower level. Room entrance was so small I could hardly get my suitcase in the door. Towels were dirty. I also requested a wake up call which never happened. Not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Â£189 for a room like that - you're having a laugh...”
Reviews.Author: doctorb54
Reviews.Content: Not enough room to swing a mouse. 5th floor 517 I think. I dropped the soap in the shower and had to get out to pick it up because there was not enough room to bend down. I stay in London 3 or 4 nights a week and would NEVER go here again! Surly front of house staff more concerned at shouting at Raul the porter on the phone. Price - breakfast not included - was outrageously expensive. I get used to small rooms in London, but this takes the biscuit. And all a little tired and worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location makes up for its disadvantages”
Reviews.Author: Sysh150989sofi
Reviews.Content: The garbage bins were not empty after the first night. Claimed to change my towles but my makeup stains were still there. While checking out, the bellman forgot where he placed my luggage. The hotel rooms were really small for a four star.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth a 4-Star; Late Check-Out is not Late Check-Out”
Reviews.Author: melvinhgf
Reviews.Content: It was advertised as a 4-star hotel. But in actual fact it is not quite the standard deserved. While I can expect the rooms in London to be small, similar to the ones in the budget hotels of Singapore, I cannot expect a 4-star hotel in London to be leaking from the ceiling and the lack of smile and politeness from the staff. 1) There was a night when it was raining the whole day and night. When I woke up, I saw the ceiling leaking water. It was a stream of water flowing. It only became better, and subsequently stopped, when I turned off the air-con. 2) The counter staff - of particular a lady of Indian origin - never did smile. And when she could not understand my question in English (probably due to accent and style of speech) she immediately turned away and continue with her work. 3) When I requested for late check-out as I was enrolled into the hotel chain's loyalty customer programme (premier club rewards), I was flatly told that the check-out time was 1 hour after the published time of 1200h. To me this was not a late check-out as small hotel even without being their loyalty member allow their customers to check out from 1230h to even 1300h. The plus points 1) a good english buffet spread with fruits and the usual English breakfast (eg beacon, scrambled eggs, bake beans, cereals etc). But after staying for 4 nights, the repetitive menu did become a bore. 2) Although the room is small (i stayed in their deluxe single), it does have the basic amenities for a business traveller. A small writing table and a single seat sofa with a side table. Tea/coffee making amenities were also available. A pity was that for this room, no refrigerator is available. Housekeeping is also prompt and proper, leaving a clean room every time. Do also note that for this type of room, there is no wardrobe.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you don't mind small beds and unpleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: Benjaminboots
Reviews.Content: I came to London for Business, my usual hotel was fully booked so I booked a room in this hotel. The area is lovely, and very close to Paddington Train Station. Upon arriving the reception area was full of unhappy customers complaining to disinterested staff which wasn't a good sign. Once I got to my room my first impression was how well furnished it was, this was short lived as I realised how tiny my room was. You can't walk around the bed, and when I lay on it with my head against the headboard my ankles hung off the end (I'm 6ft, which isn't abnormally tall!) . You get free internet however if you want it in your room it is via cable, if you want wifi you have to sit in the reception, this didn't bother me too much One plus point about my room was the iron, both iron and ironing board were good quality (i'm a bit of an iron snob when it comes to ironing my shirts). Another plus point was the tv, it was a 32" flat screen with all the freeview channels which had very good signal. I was also impressed with the bathroom, very clean and modern. A word of warning to foreign visitors, the bar is a rip off, they tried to charge me Â£3 for a bottle of water! Overall, I found the hotel bearable as long as I stayed in my room and slept diagonally in the bed! Every time I encountered the staff I found them to be dismissive and generally unpleasant. I wouldn't recommend that tourists stay here as it could spoil your trip. For business users who just want to mind their own business and keep to themselves this is ok, but I wouldn't stay here again unless I had no other choice. One final word, this place is NOT a 4 star hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “small, but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: melanie092
Reviews.Content: the rooms were extremely small, but as I was the only person staying in a double room, it didn't bother me TOO much. Only stayed two nights, but any longer and I would have gone stir crazy. If I was sharing the double room, it would have been a really tight squeeze. Must say, the rooms were clean and comfortable (for one person). Good value for money though, and the staff were really pleasant and helpful. Would recommend for short stays only

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ge0Jane
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst visiting London on business. The room was a suite and had two double beds. The reception staff were polite and helpful and arranged for our luggage to be kept even before our check-in time. They also ordered us a taxi. The bed was comfortable, albeit a little short in length. The only other 'moan' I have is that we were right next to the rather noisy lift shaft which thankfully quietened down after about 1am. The breakfast was good. We chose this hotel for the location and the price. Overall, I think we got what we paid for. Although I certainly would not want to stay in the same room again, I would consider staying in the same hotel and have been to other hotels in the same chain.

Reviews.Title: “"hated it will never book here again"”
Reviews.Author: Duuffs
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights, only stayed for one. Arrived late Friday afternoon, no working lift and the room was a square box on 5th floor. Smallest 'double' I've ever stayed in, no way is this a 4* hotel, it must make other 4/5* hotels sick to think this is what they are compared agianst!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: nnnn_11
Reviews.Content: I've travelled a lot around the globe and this was my 5th time in London. However this was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in! I've stayed in 5star hotels as well as in budget hostels with shared bathrooms. We made a reservation of a triple room but when we arrived there had only been two beds made. When we demanded they make us the third bed (which was actually a 1.50meter long sofa) they only brought a sheet and put it on the sofa, still folded. No pillow, nothing else. For the money I paid, I'd expected them to make the bed for me!? As he refused, we went down to the reception and the manager was there. She was extremly rude and almost ignorant. And at the end, they never made us the third bed. Also, there were only towels for two people in the room and it took them three calls and one hour to bring in the third one. As I mentioned, the third bed doesn't even deserve to be called a bed. Luckily I am 1.65m tall but it was still uncomfortable and even painful to sleep on that as my legs were literally hanging over the edge. There was also no view, the room was facing another building's wall that was just a meter away and there were doors facing the building which we couldn't lock. That certainly didnt make us feel safe. The bathroom was extremly small and the walls were thinner than in a hostel that costs 15â‚¬ per night. You could hear just everything there was to hear, even when someone was taking shower in their room! The only good things was the hotel's location. The breakfast was nice, too, but they refused to let us in 15mins earlier on the day we were leaving even though we asked them in advance and they had already prepared everything 30mins before. Extremely rude! All in all it was a disaster, and although it didnt ruin our stay in London I would definitely not recommend the hotel to anyone. It is not worth the money, the time, nor the nerves!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in London ! will book again !”
Reviews.Author: ithastobethebull
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a one night stay. Great location - less than 5 minutes stroll from paddington station. Immaculate (if small) room - huge TV, comfy bed and well maintained ( yes - the shower was small but did the job). Good air conditioning and a good breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff - would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cell for hire”
Reviews.Author: barrymk
Reviews.Content: Â£159 room only for a room the size of a prison cell with a steep flight of stairs immediatly inside the door, a bathroom the size of a postage stamp with a shower so small only a contortionist could soap his armpits. 12 inch gap at one side of the DOUBLE???bed and 8 inches the other. Draw your own conclusions. Lastminute.com more like lastchancesaloon.com.

Reviews.Title: “Bijou - But ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_Exec
Reviews.Content: Well I must admit being slightly concerned when told I was staying here. Then my concerns were increasing when told by the receptionist that there was a problem and I was now staying in the hotel opposite. However a Porter showed me the way and I checked in over the road. On getting to the room - I found it was ok, small but clean, modern feel and with air con. The service could have been friendlier but I was only here for one night so for that it's fine. Anything more - I'd spend a bit more and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If you want space to swing a cat - forget it”
Reviews.Author: CasaMurguia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend with a big group, Iâ€™m reviewing it based on my experience. I was in a single room (101) which I forgot to measure but the room that was about 4â€™ wide was the length of the bed from the wall to the window. The wardrobe was so small the doors would not close if because the hangers were too big for it. The bed was so uncomfortable it was mad, I was only in it for two nights and these were sleepless really as it was so uncomfortable. The breakfast was just OK but you could tell the cereals were not brand name and tasted like cardboard, the buffet was ok and I ordered poached eggs which were cooked to order and they were great. Iâ€™m heading back to London for 2 weeks soon and I will be giving this place a miss â€“ suggest you really think about it before you go.

Reviews.Title: “small or what......”
Reviews.Author: nc03
Reviews.Content: Booked this place at the very last minute and chose it because of its good location. After a long drive from Ireland we arrived at the hotel and checked in. We were given room 804...which was in the basement. We had booked a double room so when we walked in we were shocked to see the size of the room.....it was tiny!!!......no really tiny......i'm talking storage cubard tiny...There was no floorspace to put your bags...even though the bed was rammed up against the wall.As for the bathroom, you needed to reverse in ready to go it was that small!!!! As it was a basement room it was very dark and the rooms across the way ,underneath the carpark, were on top of our window!!!! Realising the crappy 15" Philips LCD wasn't working i went to the desk and asked to be moved to a bigger room with a TV that worked. The lady at the desk was polite and helpfull but informed me there were no bigger rooms but offered me a room on the fourth floor. This room was still tiny, although you could squeeze around one side of the bed. The bed wasn't comfy and room was ridiculously hot at night as the aircon wasn't working. The only saving grace was that the room was relatively clean and the TV worked, all be it with a couple of bangs of the remote. It advertises free WIFI....only in the lobby and the cable connection in the room only seems to work on the 3rd sunday of the month, if there is a full moon and if you stand on your head belting out celine dion classics!!!!! We regret not reading the reviews before we booked it...... if you're on your own a book a double room and it may be big enough, otherwise i really wouldn't bother!!!! Actually....don't bother at all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average, Good Value for Money, but.....”
Reviews.Author: tupelo70
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room for myself and my partner, and a single for a friend on a sunday night at the beginning of March for a very reasonable Â£65 per room only. The report of the single room was, "you`ve really got to see how small the room is", IT WAS.As for our double,it was a decent size with two double beds , and a small but adequate bathroom,and a large wall mounted TV.So far so good ,a good shower and comfy bed followed, but then the big problem.... Stay Well Clear of Room 21 (ground floor, Next to the lift). The NOISE.. All the Air-Con units are situated just outside the bedroom window. I am not a good sleeper and was kept awake nearly all night, my partner who usually is a heavy sleeper was woken up a lot during the night so it just wasn`t me. I complained early the next morning, only to be faced with a slightly bemused/confused receptionist`s "Sorry" and that was it. I was too tired to bother with an argument so left for breakfast in the Cafe around the corner.A bargain full English for under a fiver. In summary. I would use this hotel again, but only at a discounted price, and not on the ground floor or near to the lift. it`s also ideally placed for Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing was the location!”
Reviews.Author: carmelo82
Reviews.Content: The Room was very small and bad for 4 stars hotel. Only the bathroom was good. The price wasn't not very expensive but the terms aren't very clear. Pay attention to the price. We paid different prices for the rooms altough they were identical and we booked them at the same time. Breakfast very expensive too. But the worst thing was the services of the receptionists. They were not very kind and stunned. They made a mistake with the reservation of the taxi so I risked to miss the plane.

Reviews.Title: “This is what we call Service !”
Reviews.Author: AvDT
Reviews.Content: Due to a problem booking through booking.com (we are in the proces of sorting this out with Booking.com) we were told at arrival that I had booked for a single room instead of double. As it was Friday night late and we were tired we were pretty much disappointed. Just to be clear: This was NOT the hotel's fault, but with booking.com !! The young lady (Monica) behind the reception was very buisiness-like in a very professional manner, but with the highest level of service ! She immediately recognized our problem and tried arranging a suitable room with one of their sister hotels. unfortunately everything was fully booked. She then contacted Booking.com to find out what options there were. Although the problem still has to be sorted out with them, booing.com was very patient and tried to find alternative accomodation for us within same price/ quality range. Unfortunately with no luck unless we were prepared to stay 11 miles !!! outside London. I tried to get the hotel to arrange an extra matrass for the bedroom, but this they did not allow. In my opinion as facility manager a VERY WISE stand !! There are regulations one has to obey by and they were prepared to go far, but within certain (SAFETY) limits...My compliments. Eventually, when it became clear that Booking.com was not going to be able to accomodate us, the receptionist (Monica) arranged an upgrade for us at no additional cost! Additionally the day after we were also helped adequately and friendly by the other receptionists. The friendly service we experienced, including location of hotel AND PARKING facility for only 20 pounds a day on the premises made our stay A GREAT ONE !! Rooms are pretty small, but very clean, but when in london, you get up and go sightseeing and only come back for nap and shower. 2 points of notice: room was warm (there is aircon) and sleeping with open window as option meant having to listen to some sort of big aircon outside. We didn't mind, but bring some earplugs if you do. Thank you Monica ! Allard & MJ From The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “A REAL SCAM ...”
Reviews.Author: patsycos
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation through lastminute.com were you reserve without knowing the name of the hotel, you only discover it after paying and it is supposed to be a good deal ... DISASTER , we arrived at the hotel where a person who bearely spoke english told us after leaving our credit card print that we were changing of hotel . The hotel was a couple of minutes away, nicer than the first but ... the room was in the basement without window and ... with the water pump of the building next to the room. We asked to be changed , the second room was also on the basement but with a problem of heating. Too make a long story short , they changed us three times of room. We finished finally on the 6th floor in a nice room but completely stressed. For a surprise this was a bad surprise!! The only nice person was an employee that saw our distress and tried to find a room so that we could sleep. Never an excuse , never an explanation.

Reviews.Title: “dont always trust what other people say, use your own mind. its not as bad as what some people make out”
Reviews.Author: davemcd34
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here, i was quite apprehensive at booking this hotel but as it was what seems to be good value, Â£165 for the 2 of us for 2 nights including breakfast, i couldnt fault that. Yes its true that was a little hard to find but once you know where you are its actually in a great location, virtually behind Paddington station. Perfect! So on checking in, make sure that your booking is in the correct name, couldnt find us on the system as my partners surname was spelt incorrectly. Anyway we were charged a Â£10 fee for something but unsure really as to what that is for. was told to cover any extras but should get it back in a week. i will wait for that but wont hold my breath!! ok so for the room itself.....room 002 we were allocated and was told it was large room, mmmm not really the right description i would say. pokey springs to mind but as it was only a base, size not that important. the bed was a double but for 2 people it was a bit erm how would i put it........compact maybe lol. the room did have sufficient storage space to hang clothes etc. had safe which is free, decent size tv with plenty of channels, kettle with tea & coffee etc, iron and board in wardrobe which i thought was great, NO fridge though. Furnishings probably could do with updating, curtains need hanging correctly, covers on bed clean. Bathroom was really small and getting into the shower was not easy especially if you are tall and slightly bigger, dont get me wrong we are not obese people here but 2 tall average built people. you probably need to be under a size 34 waist or size 10 lol but the shower was really good. overall the room was clean and tidy but not big enough to accomodate 2 people however as its only a base you can deal with it for 2 nights but wouldnt for any longer. so for the reception and restaurant staff.....very pleasant on arrival and the 2 who were at breakfast were pleasant too. the price we paid did include breakfast which was good enough but if i had to pay the Â£15 each i probably wouldnt have. plenty of choice with full english available, continental and cereals, fruit, croissants (dry) and small selection of bread etc. the full english consisted of bacon (smoked) sausages (catering ones) hash browns, beans (warm) scrambled eggs, mushrooms (tinned variety...yuck). The coffee was nice but maybe could be little warmer. The restaurant itself was very clean and quite contemporary which i did like. if you do get the room next to reception beware, it does get noisy and as you have to smoke out the front, it is right by the bedroom window. was really noisy throughout last night and we had awful nights sleep. this review is not me whinging but a real review of what it is like. the hotel is good enough to stay in and for the price you cant go wrong. should it be classed as 4*? not really, more 3*, would i stay again? yes but not in that room. would i reccommend? probably.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: bdk418
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January, paying GBP 58 per night. At that price, we felt good about our stay. The rooms were small but clean. The breakfast was decent. The proximity to Paddington Station is great. We then returned in February, and the price went up to GBP 130! They said it was a simple case of supply and demand. We were not in a position to shop around for other hotels at the time. Even more so, we took two rooms the second time there. One was for our 77 year old mother. They put her in a tiny room (smaller than a walk-in closet), where she got to by descending 6 steep stairs. The miniscule bathroom was midway down the stairs. We asked for a room change. They then put her in a room she had to enter sideways to get past the dresser in the hallway. We asked for another change of room, to finally get one that was sufficient. The person at the front desk had real "attitude" through the whole experience. Needless to say, we will not use them again - especially at the higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at Â£60, rip-off if you have to pay more...”
Reviews.Author: travelmerlin82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in Feb based on a laterooms offer at Â£60ish for a standard double. The decor was fine, obviously recently refreshed. However, this is the smallest 'double' I have ever seen: there is less than half a foot between the bed and the window, and literally no space between the bed and the other wall. Approx half a meter between the foot of the bed and the wall with a flatscreen on it. The bathroom was fine, but you can literally use the sink and the shower whilst sitting on the loo! Possibly the strangest thing was the flight of stairs immediately behind the door! If you weren't concentrating, you would fall down the seven or so steps to the foot of the bed! The staff were efficient and friendly. The major issue here though, is that the following day it became clear that I had been eaten alive by bedbugs: the hotel really needs to get professional pest control in to deal with the problem asap. Actually quite a shame, because a hotel at Â£60 in Paddington that doesn't look like a dump is hard to come by.....

Reviews.Title: “adorable stay”
Reviews.Author: MariaRitaEumesma
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and I really felt very wellcome. One of the most important things to me is that I can feel confortable. And that not only includes the room itself (comfortable bed, cute deco...) but also the way my questions and needs are answerd. I must say i faced no problems during my stay, it was indeed very pleasant and I will definitly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot boast about this hotel enough!”
Reviews.Author: ndvine
Reviews.Content: You can believe me when I say my experience at the Shaftesbury is extremely pleasant that I did not want to leave - albeit the fact that it also meant I did not want my holiday to end. I have heard horror stories of the less known hotels of London, my only other stay in London being at the London Hilton Metropole. I expected the worst after reading the reviews, although the size of the rooms did not really matter to me. The cost seemed decent, location was amazing (Paddington!), and I assumed it was clean - judging from the pictures of course. Cleanliness is very important to me as I think it would be for everyone else. I booked a two night stay, and found it very surprising how big our room was! I wasn't informed until I found out for myself that we were upgraded to a Twin Club Room - spacious check, microwave oven check, free WiFi check, clean check, and relaxing nights check. Mind you, there is no fridge, but for a two night stay, it didn't matter for us. I would not know how the rooms would have been if we were given the Deluxe Twin Room we originally booked for. But, the fact that they had upgraded us to a bigger room just shows that they are courteous - and judging from another review I read, most times, they will upgrade if you ask. Checking in was not a hassle and the staff were generally very helpful (although I would definitely suggest that more information be handed to us when we check in, so there isn't the awkward need to have to call the reception constantly about heat, WiFi, etc. - but on another note one staff was very very helpful and encouraged us to call if anything so minus the awkwardness), always on call and will help you with anything. I will definitely be staying here again (summer will be a breeze with the air conditioner) - consider me from now on, a regular guest.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute rip-off, do not book”
Reviews.Author: Fabio083
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed by this hotel, the pictures look very nice and clean, however the room was smaller than a prison cell. The walls are literally wrapped around the bed, I could not stay in that room as my girlfriend is clostrophobic (I myself would have become clostrophobic by just staying there for an hour). We cancelled our booking and went to a different hotel, as the manager refused to upgrade us to the bigger room size. He also tried to convince us that that size was standard for london, which it is not. I would strongly advise anyone NEVER to go to this hotel, nor to any other hotel part of the shaftsbury chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: shahzadyusuf
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean & smelling fresh when i entered first time. Bed was so comfortable, my jet lag was over in hours. Toilet was quite big & very clean. Service was top class. Only thing is that all these does not come cheap, atleast not in London.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly carpets small rooms n overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Zbobby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after moving from Anor hotel in paddington Lancaster hotel. Shaftesbury rooms are overpriced n their rooms at 55 pounds w english breakfast for a deluxe double room is not worth it. The carpets r smelly

Reviews.Title: “Small and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: fromthestreet
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on RatestoGo from overseas as a treat for 2 nights in London. Positives: Handy location, clean, friendly staff. Negatives: Booked a 'deluxe double room' discounted from Â£300 per night, so expected something half decent, and the photos on the website looked good, but ended up in a broom cupboard-sized room, and the size of the bathroom was getting towards a joke (you could only partly open the shower door! - it must have been about 2ft sq). To be fair, I should have complained at the time, as I am sure they could have found us a larger room! So nice hotel, but do not expect 4 star standards, and definitely check your room before paying!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: meems3434
